ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: ï‚§ Developed e-primer. ï‚§ Produced 700 graded books for neo-literates which include 20 books for Urdu speaking neo-literates. ï‚§ SRC has bagged best research award for its study on â€œReading Ability of Neo-literatesâ€ during the year 1993 ï‚§ SRC has bagged NLM-UNESCO Award 2010 for outstanding contribution in the field of Adult Education. ï‚§ SRC has bagged Saakshar Bharat Award -2012 ï‚§ Conducted 30 research studies related to Basic Literacy, Post Literacy, Continuing Education and Impact of Literacy programmes. ï‚§ Conducted a Pilot Study on HP Literacy Testing Solutions. ï‚§ Undertaken UNFPA Project on â€œAdolescence Life Skill Developmentâ€. ï‚§ The popular story SEETHAMMA KATHA, a lesson in the SRC Primer has ignited spark in the Dubagunta village of Nellore district leading, to Anti-arrack Movement. ï‚§ SRC has the distinction of bringing out a variety Neo-literate material using Cinema Titles. ï‚§ SRC has the distinction of bringing out Computer Based Literacy Testing Tools and computer based literacy primer. ï‚§ SRC has brought out Vintoo Nerchukondi (Interactive Audio Lessons on Basic Literacy) and Chilaka Nerpina Patham - a Telefilm on Literacy and Continuing Education. ï‚§ SRC has the distinction of bringing out 23 Video films on Motivation and various themes of Continuing Education Programme. ï‚§ SRC has developed literature related to the themes of Inter Personal Media Campaign (IPMC) viz., financial literacy, legal literacy, electoral literacy and disaster management. ï‚§ SRC has the distinction of receiving grants from ACCU, Japan for the adaptation of two books â€œMedicinal Plantsâ€ and â€œSavingsâ€. ï‚§ SRC has trained field functionaries and others since 1988 on Total Literacy Campaigns, Saakshar Bharat, IPMC, etc.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: TBAI is a national exclusively TB focused NGO based in Hyderabad working with a vision â€œA TB free Indiaâ€. TBAI at present has its operations in Andhra Pradesh and Delhi. All our programs support Government run National TB program. In North Delhi, TBAI is running diagnostic facilities for TB (Tuberculosis Unit) in Burari, a slum area predominately a habitat of migrants. People living in the area are at high risk of developing TB and related diseases. Govt. health facilities in the area are nonexistent and people affected have to travel 12-15km to visit government health facility to get TB care. TBAI has been implementing this project with a mission to bring access to TB care and treatment through variety of awareness activities, active engagement of community leading to increased testing for TB. Project is supported by a corporate donor Eli Lilly MDR TB Partnership since April 2008. Project started in small way catering to 1 lakh population and is now serving 5 lakh. Community engagement is planned to Building Partnerships, Advocate and spread knowledge about TB quality service. Volunteers from the community are identified, motivated, trained and placed within the community who act as referral sources. Till date project had identified 2023 new TB cases and all of them are registered for treatment.264 volunteers are trained, working.

A Molecule called hemoglobin is found in red blood cells that holds oxygen all over the body.Hemoglobin is elastic, round and stable in a healthy human.This makes it possible to float across red blood cells.But the composition of hemoglobin is unhealthy if you have sick cell disease.It is forming rods that clump. It refers to compact and bent red blood cells.The odd cells obstruct the flow of blood.It is dangerous and can result in severe discomfort,organ damage,heartstrokes, and other symptoms.
